deliverable.definition: A deliverable is a tangible or intangible object produced as a result of the project that is intended to be delivered to a customer (either internal or external).

project.definition: An overarching initiative with a defined scope and goal, broken down into smaller managable "sprints" in Agile methodologies.

story.definition: A story is a small, specific requirement that is part of a project. Stories are used in Agile methodologies to break down the work into small, manageable pieces.

task.definition: A task is a specific unit of work that needs to be completed as part of a story.

task.label: Task
task.description: A task is a basic building block of a project. It can be a simple todo or a complex part of a project.

story.label: Story
story.description: A task is a basic building block of a project. It can be a simple todo or a complex part of a project.

deliverable.label: Deliverable
deliverable.description: A deliverable is a tangible or intangible object produced as a result of the project that is intended to be delivered to a customer (either internal or external).
